Frequently Asked Questions

How do I clean and maintain my nail clippers and files?

To keep your tools hygienic, wipe clippers and files with rubbing alcohol after each use. For deeper cleaning, wash with warm soapy water and dry thoroughly. Regular maintenance helps prevent rust and keeps your tools performing at their best.

What is the best type of nail clipper for thick nails?

Thick nails are best trimmed with a sturdy, sharp clipper designed for toenails or heavy-duty use. Look for clippers with a wide jaw and strong leverage, such as the Rotating Nail Clipper or a dedicated toenail clipper, to ensure a clean, effortless cut.

Can I bring nail clippers and files on an airplane?

Most standard nail clippers and TSA-approved metal nail files are allowed in carry-on luggage. However, some sharp or pointed tools may be restricted. Always check current airline and TSA guidelines before packing grooming tools for travel.

How often should I replace my nail file?

Replace your nail file when it becomes worn down, smooth, or less effective at shaping nails. Glass and metal files can last for years with proper care, while emery boards may need replacing every few weeks, depending on use.
